plurals.description: Shown in the schedule to indicate how many sessions are available on that particular time slot.
plurals.name: schedule_block_subtitle

plurals.description: Shows as a notification on the system bar to alert user that some of their sessions are about to begin.
plurals.name: session_notification_text

plurals.description: Shown as a notification on the system bar to alert user that some of their sessions are about to begin.
plurals.name: session_notification_ticker

plurals.description: Indicates a certain number of sessions.
plurals.name: session_plurals

resources.string:
Google I/O 2015
Version %s

Terms of Service

Privacy Policy

This app won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet.

The data you are viewing may be out of date.
Session rating bar with a minimum of one star and a maximum of five stars
Since you\'re attending in person, we can set up this device to access the conference Wi-Fi network (5Ghz only). By configuring your Wi-Fi now, you\'ll help prevent network congestion.
No captions found for this session.
No more upcoming sessions.\nSee you next year!
Touch the Google I/O 2015 logo above to sign in and begin using the app.

Your use of this application is governed by:

a) the Google Terms of Service (www.google.com/policies/terms);
b) Google's Privacy Policy (www.google.com/policies/privacy); and
c) any applicable Google service-specific terms of service or privacy policies.

Google's terms of service and privacy policies may be updated from time to time and without notice.

This application collects certain information as you use it, including via Google Analytics. Google's Privacy Policy explains how Google treats your information and protects your privacy when you use the application. By using the application, you agree to the use of your data in accordance with Google's Privacy Policy.
Attending I/O in person (you can change this in Settings)
Attending I/O remotely (you can change this in Settings)

string.description: This text is shown to a user when they are in the Explore I/O screen while at the conference. It gives them information about an afternoon event on the schedule.
string.name: explore_io_msgcards_after_hours_card

resources.string:
After Hours

This is a party you don\'t want to miss! Attendees are invited to enjoy food, drinks, music, games, and more during the evening of May 28. The conference badge and NFC wristband are required for entrance.

string.description: This message is displayed on the Explore I/O screen to ask users whether they would like to opt in to receive messages regarding the conference.
string.name: explore_io_msgcards_ask_opt_in

resources.string:
Conference Messages
Would you like to opt-in to receive important messages about the conference? Messages are time based and may include promotional messages from partners.

string.description: Conference Credentials, shown the day before the event giving users general event information.
string.name: explore_io_msgcards_conf_creds_card

resources.string:
Conference Credentials
Each attendee will receive a non-transferable NFC enabled wristband this year. Your wristband & I/O badge will allow you access to Keynote, Sessions, Sandbox, and After Hours party. Remember to wear it at all times.

string.description: This text is shown to a user when they are in the Explore I/O screen while at the conference. It gives them information about the keynote event on the schedule.
string.name: explore_io_msgcards_keynote_access_card

resources.string:
Keynote Access
Your wristband color denotes your keynote access.

Blue wristband = Keynote Access
Line starts outside Moscone West on 4th Street and wraps around Minna Street. .

Gray wristband = Reserved Keynote Seating
Line starts outside Moscone West on 4th Street.

Orange wristband = Playground
Line starts outside Moscone West on Howard Street.

string.decscription: Question presented to users on a card in the Explore I/O screen if they have are using the conference Wifi.
string.name: explore_io_msgcards_wifi_feedback

resources.string: Have connectivity feedback? Share it with us on social channels via the #io15wifi hashtag.

There is a newer version of this application available on Google Play.
Are you attending I/O remotely or in person in San Francisco?

Be excellent to each other.
We want I/O to be an excellent experience for everyone regardless of gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, differing abilities, neurodiversity, physical appearance, body size, ethnicity, nationality, age or religion. Treat everyone with respect. Participate while acknowledging that everyone deserves to be here -- and each of us has the right to enjoy our experience without fear of harassment, discrimination, or condescension, whether blatant or via micro-aggressions.

Speak up if you see or hear something.
Harassment is not tolerated, and you are empowered to politely engage when you or others are disrespected. Also, assume positive intent. The person making you feel uncomfortable may not be aware of what they are doing, and politely bringing their behavior to their attention is encouraged.

Practice saying "Yes and" to each other.
Build on each other’s ideas. We all benefit when we create together.
Please choose an account to use:
Before we begin, here is some important legal information regarding your use of this app. This will only take a minute!
Welcome to the Google I/O app!
